Moto Display keeps flashing on my device.
This has been seen on Moto E4 series. This can be a problem in the Moto Display app itself or the proximity sensor. This version should fix the issue.
Why do I get the \"MotoDisplay Handwave is running\" notification?

In Android Oreo, this notification is necessary to make the user aware that an app is running in background which can potentially decrease battery life of the device. However this app doesn\'t use a lot of your resources. Read the next answer for details.
Does this app consume a lot of battery?

This app consumes minimum (very close to zero) power when the screen is off in MOTOROLA DEVICES WITH MOTO DISPLAY TURNED ON.\n This is because Moto Display actually keeps the proximity sensor turned on always, but doesn\'t use this wave gesture.\n For non-moto devices, this app may drain some battery as the proximity sensor is always on, especially if \"Wave-n-hold for screen off\" feature is on. Please read the next answer.
How much power does this app exactly consume?
You can check the battery consumption by clicking the hamburger menu
Click \"Device info\" and check \"Power used since last boot\". You will find that not a lot of power is drained by the app, often less than 1mAh.
Why was ads added? I liked the app as free!

Ads have been added to support further development of the app. Also the ads can be disabled easily, without needing to buy anything! Keeping the ads on serves as an incentive as the app will continue receiving exciting features via Integrations.
